page.title: 07MARSDEN QUARRY.
page.content: MARSDEN QUARRY. Quarrying is an old industry in the Marsden district.Layers of various limestones were formed from the compression of sands and mud deposited under the sea. The present quarry is about ninety years old and is owned by the Tilcon company. Every year six hundred thousand tons of dolomitic limestone is quarried by blasting. The quarry uses static and mobile machinery to produce limestone for use in road construction, agriculture, fire prevention, glass and steel industries. The limestone is exported to Japan,the West Indies, and many European countries. . There is enough limestone to extend the quarry but local residents and conservation groups oppose it.
